meanings.definition: To cause to be excessively excited or agitated.
meanings.sent1: The loud music at the party was overexciting for the guests.
meanings.sent2: The children were overexciting their puppy with their constant play.
meanings.sent3: The overexciting game of tag led to lots of laughter and running around.
meanings.sent4: Her overexciting storytelling made the mundane seem magical.
meanings.sent5: The overexciting roller coaster ride left everyone breathless and thrilled.

meanings.definition: To become excessively excited or agitated.
meanings.sent1: The suspenseful movie was overexciting, keeping everyone on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overexcite easily when talking about her favorite topics.
meanings.sent3: The overexciting news of a surprise party almost gave away the secret.
meanings.sent4: His overexciting imagination turned everyday objects into fantastical creatures.
meanings.sent5: The overexciting race to the finish line had everyone cheering and clapping.
